intro: Clematis jialasaensis var. macrantha, commonly known as the large-flowered clematis, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its showy, often blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows as a climbing vine with slender, woody stems and compound leaves. Its flowers are borne in clusters and are notable for their size and vibrant color. It is appreciated in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in a variety of garden conditions.
